intro: Tecomanthe ternatensis, commonly known as the Ternate moonvine, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces yellow-orange berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Tecomanthe ternatensis is often found in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical studies and horticultural cultivation.
